Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: Zisk, S.H., G.H. Pettengill, and G.W. Catuna, High-resolution radar maps of the lunar surface at 3.8-cm wavelength, The Moon, 10, 17-50, 1974.

Instrument_PDS3.instrument_desc:
INSTRUMENT: RADIO TELESCOPE HOST: HAYSTACK OBSERVATORY
Instrument Information ====================== Instrument Id : RTLS Instrument Host Id : HSTK Instrument Name : RADIO TELESCOPE Instrument Type : RADAR Build Date : 1968 Instrument Length : 36.000000 Instrument Width : 36.000000
Instrument Description ====================== The Haystack observatory system is used for a variety of scientific objectives. It consists of a 36 meter diameter parabolic antenna, 500 kilowatt radar transmitter, 3.8 centimeter maser amplifier receiver, hydrogen-maser time standard for frequency and timing control, and a CDC-3300 computer for real-time data recording.
Science Objectives ================== To make radar observations of planetary bodies.
Operational Considerations ========================== NOT APPLICABLE
Calibration Description ======================= Transmitter frequency calibrated with a hydrogen maser.
Section 'HSTK' ============== Total Fovs : NOT APPLICABLE
'HSTK' Section Parameter 'RADAR ECHO POWER' ------------------------------------------- That part of the transmitted power scattered by the target and received by the radar antenna.
Instrument Parameter Name : RADAR ECHO POWER Sampling Parameter Name : TIME Instrument Parameter Unit : WATTS Sampling Parameter Unit : SECOND
Description ----------- NOT APPLICABLE
Sensitivity ----------- NOT APPLICABLE
